member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge
member.summary:
The wwDotNetBridge class provides a host of COM support functions for Visual FoxPro. It allows you to host the .NET runtime without relying on COM interop to load types, rather it acts as a proxy for instantiation and other tasks.
This library can be used itself to load .NET and types, or you can use it as a helper with COM interop in which case you have to instantiate it as a COM object and call its methods directly rather than using the FoxPro helper class.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.LoadAssembly(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an assembly into the AppDomain by its fully qualified assembly name

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.LoadAssemblyFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an assembly into the AppDomain by a fully qualified assembly path

member.summary: Creates a type reference from a given type name if the assembly is already loaded.

member.summary: Creates a type reference from a given type name if the assembly is already loaded.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstance_Internal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates an instance of a class based on its type name. Assumes that the type's assembly is already loaded.
Note this will be a little slower than the versions that work with assembly name specified because this code has to search for the type first rather than directly activating it.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstance_Internal(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Routine that loads an assembly by its 'application assembly name' - unsigned assemblies must be visible via the .NET path (current path or BIN dir) and GAC assemblies must be referenced by their full assembly name.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstanceOnType(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates an instance of a .NET type and stores it on an existing property of another type.
Use this method if you can't access a type through COM ([ComVisible(false)]

This method supports '.' syntax so you can use "Property.ChildProperty" to walk the object hierarchy in the string property parameter.
This method also supports accessing of Array/Collection indexers (Item[1])

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a property or field value using a base object and sub members including . syntax. For example, you can access: this.oCustomer.oData.Company with (this,"oCustomer.oData.Company") This method also supports indexers in the Property value such as: Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
member.param: Parent object to 'start' parsing from. Typically this will be the Page.
The property to retrieve. Example: 'Customer.Entity.Company'

Name of the property to set
value to set it to

Name of the field to set
value to set it to

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a value on an object. Supports . syntax for named properties (ie. Customer.Entity.Company) as well as indexers.
member.param: Object to set the property on.
Property to set. Can be an object hierarchy with . syntax and can include indexers. Examples: Customer.Entity.Company, Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
Value to set the property to

members.member:

1st - Method name, 2nd - 1st parameter, 3rd - 2nd parm etc.

Culture for numeric and DateTime values

member.param: The string to convert from
The type to convert to
Culture used for numeric and datetime values.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyExCom(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Sets the value of a field or property via Reflection. This method alws for using '.' syntax to specify objects multiple levels down.
ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyEx(this,"Invoice.LineItemsCount",10)
which would be equivalent of:
this.Invoice.LineItemsCount = 10;
member.param: Object to set the property on.
Property to set. Can be an object hierarchy with . syntax.
Value to set the property to

members.member:
Wrapper method to call a 'dynamic' (non-typelib) method on a COM object
1st - Method name, 2nd - 1st parameter, 3rd - 2nd parm etc.

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray
member.summary:
COM Wrapper for an array that is assigned as variable. This instance allows Visual FoxPro to manipulate the array using the wwDotNetBridge Array functions that are require a parent object.
When passed to a method that requires an array the instance member is passed as the actual parameter.
Note: You should always use wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstance to create an instance of this array from Fox code otherwise there's no instance set.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new COM Array from an existing array instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateEmptyArray(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a .NET array instance with 0 items on this ComArray instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Deprecated: Don't use

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateArray(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a new array instance with size number of items pre-set. Elements are unassigned but array is dimensioned.
Use SetItem() to assign values to each array element
member.param: The type of the array's elements
Size of array to create

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AssignFrom(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a .NET array to this COM wrapper. Has to be passed as a base instance (ie. parent instance of the array) and the name of the array because once the array hits VFP code it's already been converted into a VFP array so only internal reflection will allow getting the actual reference into ComArray.
member.param: Instance of the parent object of the array
Name of the array property on the parent instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AssignTo(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns this ComArray's array instance to the specified property

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateItem
member.summary:
Creates an instance of the array's member type without actually adding it to the array. This is useful to more easily create members without having to specify the full type signature each time.
Assumes that the array exists already so that the item type can be inferred. The type is inferred from the arrays instance using GetElementType().

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateItemExplicit
member.summary:
Creates an instance of the array's member type without actually adding it to the array. This is useful to more easily create members without having to specify the full type signature each time.
This version works of the actual elements in the array instance rather than using the 'official' element type. Looks at the first element in the array and uses its type.
Assumes that the array exists already so that the item type can be inferred.
member.param: If true looks at the first element and uses that as the type to create. Use this option if the actual element type is of type object when the array was automatically generated such as when FromEnumerable() was called.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an item from the array.
member.param: 0 based array index to retrieve

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.SetItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Assigns a value to an array element that already exists.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AddItem(System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds an item to the internal array instance.
Array should exist before adding items.
member.param: an instance of the item to add.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.RemoveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes an item from the array.
member.param: 0 based index of item to remove

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Clear
member.summary: Clears out the array contents

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.FromEnumerable(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Creates an instance from an enumerable

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Instance
member.summary: The actual array instance returned as an object. This instance is set and passed to and from .NET calls made with InvokeMethod and explicit property assignments with Set/GetProperty.

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Count
member.summary: Returns the length of the .NET array contained in Instance

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid
member.summary: .NET System.Guid values cannot be passed to VFP as they are non COM exported value types. So any Guid values passed to and received from .NET need to be passed around as a ComGuid instance. This class wraps an internal Guid instance member and allows access to the GuidString property via string.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid.New
member.summary: Sets the Guid instance to a new Guid Value

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid.Empty
member.summary: Sets the Guid to Guid.Empty

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid.Guid
member.summary: The actual Guid instance that can be read by a .NET handler

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid.GuidString
member.summary: String representation of the Guid.

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue
member.summary:
Class that converts to various .NET types when passed a FoxPro value.
This object can then be used as an input to try and force parameters to a specific .NET type

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetInt16(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a Short value which is not supported in Visual FoxPro

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetInt64(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets an Int64 value which is not supported in Visual FoxPro

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetSingle(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a Single Value on the

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetDecimal(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a Decimal value. This can actually be done in FoxPro with CAST(val as Currency)

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetLong(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a Long (64 bit) integer value

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetByte(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a byte value which is similar to Int16.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetEnum(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns an enum value to the value structure. This allows to pass enum values to methods and constructors to ensure that method signatures match properly
member.param: full type and value name. Example: System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxOptions.OK

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetDbNull
member.summary: Allows setting of DbNull from FoxPro since DbNull is an inaccessible value type for FoxPro.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromProperty(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Value property from a property retrieved from .NET Useful to transfer value in .NET that are marshalled incorrectly in FoxPro such as Enum values (that are marshalled as numbers)
member.param: An object reference to the base object
Name of the property

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromStaticProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value property from a static property retrieved from .NET. Useful to transfer value in .NET that are marshalled incorrectly in FoxPro such as Enum values (that are marshalled as numbers)
member.param: Full type name as a string - can also be an Enum type
The static property name

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromInvokeMethod(System.Object,System.String,Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray)
member.summary: Sets the Value property from a method call that passes it's positional arguments as an array. This version accepts a ComArray directly so it can be called directly from FoxPro with a ComArray instance
member.param: Object instance
Method to call
An array of the parameters passed (use ComArray and InvokeMethod)

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromInvokeMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sets the Value property from a method call that passes it's positional arguments as an array.
member.param: Object instance
Method to call
An array of the parameters passed (use ComArray and InvokeMethod)

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromCreateInstance(System.String,Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray)
member.summary: Sets the Value property from a CreateInstance call. Useful for value types that can't be passed back to FoxPro.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetValueFromCreateInstance(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sets the Value property from a CreateInstance call. Useful for value types that can't be passed back to FoxPro.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.SetGuid(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets value to a .NET Guid. Creates a GUID from either ComGuid instance a string, or if null creates a new GUID.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.NewGuid
member.summary: Create a new Guid on the Value structure

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.GetGuid
member.summary: Retrieves a GUID value as a string from the Value structure

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComValue.Value
member.summary: Internally this value is set by the various SetXXX methods. It's of type objcect but set to the appropriate .NET subtype.
